content:
• Friday, September 13, 2013

  • After-Hours Gainers / Losers

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AMAP +9%. INO +2%. NOR +1%. GTIV +1%. CUR +1%.
    After-hours top losers: GORO -7%. CCXI -3%. GOGO -3%. SQM -3%. WWAV -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: EPI +5.5%. XHB +4.2%. UNG +3.8%. MOO +3.7%. FCG +3.7%.
    • ETF Losers: VXX -10.2%. GDXJ -9.7%. GDX -8.5%. PSLV -7.9%. SLV -6.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • ENTR

    Entropic closes higher after announcing new design wins

    • Korean IT services firm LG CNS (separate from LG Electronics) is using an Entropic (ENTR +2.6%) set-top SoC in an Android-based set-top to be sold to its pay-TV clients. (PR)
    • Also: Top Japanese pay-TV provider J:COM is using Entropic's high-end EN7588 set-top SoC in a box meant to enable Web-based video-on-demand services, and an Entropic satellite TV switch chip has been approved for use in set-top boxes deployed by Sky Italia. (PRs: I, II)
    • Entropic rallied two weeks ago after announcing Chinese OEM Jiuzhou is using its Ethernet-over-coax home networking chips in HD set-tops. Shares have rallied ~20% from their early August lows, but remain down 19% YTD thanks to unexpected order weakness from U.S. MSOs.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • SHPG

    Sanofi, Shire interested in ViroPharma: Bloomberg

    • Details emerge on a possible ViroPharma (VPHM +27.4%) sale after Bloomberg initially reported the firm had hired Goldman to help it evaluate its options.
    • Citing sources, Bloomberg identifies Sanofi (SNY +0.1%) and Shire (SHPG +1.1%)Â as the interested parties.
    • Meanwhile, the Street is busy trying to nail the valuation.
    • Mark Deutsche down for $46-52/share.
    • More on the prospective deal here
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • MKTO

    Marketo slides after pricing follow-on

    • Shares of Marketo (MKTO -5.5%) slide after the company priced its 6M share follow-on at $35.50/share this morning. Of the offering, the company will sell 662K shares itself, raising $23.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • NTR

    Potash cut to Sell at Cantor Fitzgerald

    • Potash (POT +2.3%) is cut to Sell from Hold with a $31 price target, down from $36, at Cantor Fitzgerald, which says the stock's recent surge is unwarranted as potash prices continue to fall.
    • A lack of demand is evident and POT may have to curtail production, which would in turn reduce earnings, the firm says; potash prices in India and Brazil already have plunged 15%-20%.
    • Also, the Uralkali-Belaruskali dispute will take time to resolve, and it's possible that any reunion could come at the expense of its competitors at least until it has regained lost market share.
    • Shares are higher on a report that Sergei Kerimov has arranged to sell his 21.7% stake in POT for $3.7B.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • VNO

    Roth resigns from J.C. Penney board as Vornado moves to exit stake

    • Vornado Realty Trust (VNO +0.2%) CEO Steven Roth resigns from the J.C. Penney (JCP -1%) board as the company (Vornado) reiterates its intention to sell the rest of its holdings in the retailer. Vornado exited about 40% of its 9.9% stake in J.C. Penney earlier this year, leaving it with 6.1%.
    • SEC Form 13.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 10 Comments
  • HUN

    Hunstman hustles higher on upgrade, rumor of interest in Tronox

    • Huntsman (HUN +2.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $24 price target at KeyBanc based on valuation and earnings upside driven by further improvement in the polyurethanes and performance products segments, which account for more than 70% of sales.
    • The firm also sees the possibility of portfolio changes in coming quarters as another positive catalyst for HUN shares.
    • Tronox (TROX +7.9%) shares are higher on rumors HUN is interested in the company, which also is a major player in the titanium dioxide market.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • ESV

    Offshore drillers Ensco, Transocean, Noble Corp. downgraded at Bernstein

    • Offshore drillers Ensco (ESV -2.4%), Transocean (RIG -1.8%) and Noble Corp. (NE -1.2%) are downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform at Bernstein, which believes the growth of supply has outpaced demand and that high vs. low spec bifurcation should prove temporary.
    • The firm suggests “the valuation of high spec assets suggests simply playing high spec rigs is highly risky should the cycle turn more dramatically.”
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • DSX

    Dry bulkers slide, Deutsche says capesize rally may have peaked

    • After rallying hard on the back of surging capesize rates, red-hot dry bulkers take a breather.
    • Perhaps weighing on sentiment is Deutsche's Justin Yagerman, who says shipping rates may be at a "near-to-medium term peak [as] the recent Cape-led rate rally may only be temporary."
    • Yagerman does expect the market to continue "to recover over the next several years."
    • Diana Shipping (DSX -3.3%) catches a downgrade to Hold (price target is $12).
    • ETF - SEA -0.4%
    • GNK -3.8% EGLE -1.3% DRYS -1% SB -3.8% SBLK -3.6% BALT -1.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 10 Comments
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma sale rumor no surprise, BioCryst along for the ride

    • News that ViroPharma (VPHM +24.9%) may have hired Goldman to help the company explore a possible sale won't surprise those who have followed the stock this year.
    • Back in June, the shares spiked suddenly after Reuters said the firm had attracted preliminary interest from several potential suitors.
    • A buyer would get Cinryze, VPHM's HAE treatment which some say could reach peak sales of $800M by 2020. Cinryze sales in Q2 were $91M, up 22% Y/Y.
    • There's also the pipeline catalyst maribavir, which the sell-side thinks could provide meaningful upside (Deutsche in June: 50% chance of $220M in peak sales; Jefferies in June: Maribavir may be "biggest potential source of upside").
    • Also moving predictably higher on the news is BioCryst (BCRX +3.1%), whose BCX4161 also treats HAE.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • PLXS

    Plexus trades higher on Citi PT hike

    • Shares of Plexus (PLXS +1.7%) trade higher after Citigroup hikes its PT to $38 ($36 previous) and maintains a Hold rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • BTH

    Blyth squeezes higher

    • Shares of Blyth (BTH +12.9%) squeeze higher on 5 times average daily volume. Shorts are scrambling to cover, with a staggering 79.1% of the float sold short as of Aug. 30. The move follows a 5.8% gain yesterday after CEO Robert Goergen disclosed he had purchased 10K shares.
    • Hat tip to SA contributor John Gilliam, who wroteÂ earlier this morning that shares may go parabolic due to an overwhelming number of shares sold short combined with insider purchases (both reported and "shadow").
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • UNFI

    United Natural Foods climbs on FQ4 beat, outlook, Canaccord PT hike

    • Shars of United Natural Foods (UNFI +14.8%) continue to climb after the company's FQ4 results beat expectations.
    • Management guides for FY14 revenue of $6.65B-$6.78B (consensus of $6.61B) and EPS of $2.40-$2.50 (consensus of $2.49).
    • Canaccord hiked its PT to $68 ($63 previous) and reiterated a Buy rating, noting, "UNFI’s current acceleration gives us confidence that the natural and organic sector is incrementally strong."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • SHPG

    ViroPharma may seek sale: Bloomberg

    • ViroPharma (VPHM +21.8%) soars on report the company has hired Goldman to help it explore a sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    Â 

    • Midday top 10 gainers: HAST +35%. LAKE +39%. PRIS +30%. RMTI +21%. CTIC +20%. ULTA +17%. UNFI +15%. OCLR +15%. BTH +12%. CUR +12%.
    • Midday top 10 Losers: CRDS -18%. ARTX -17%. AVNR -17%. GALE -16%. ERB -16%. PRAN -14%. DRWI -11%. MTEX -11%. OTCPK:TELOZ -11%. SGA -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • QEP

    QEP Resources downgraded at Deutsche Bank, shares -2.3%

    • QEPÂ Resources (QEP -2.3%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $34 price target, down from $37, at Deutsche Bank.
    • Although the firm remains fans of QEP's management and capital allocation approach, it says it can no longer construct a viable thesis of sustainable outperformance.
    • QEP has made the right moves YTD, shifting its upstream assets to oil and realizing value from the midstream business, but the asset is no longer fundamentally undervalued.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • LEU

    USEC spikes on rumors of new financing in place

    • Strength in USEC shares (USU +7.2%) since around noon is attributed to speculation that new funding for the uranium supplier is in place and will be announced shortly (Briefing.com).
    • In July, USEC amended its cooperative agreement with the Department of Energy to provide ~$30M in additional government cost-share, bringing total DOE funding to $227M and funding the program through the end of Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • GME

    EA, GameStop rally following favorable NPD data

    • NPD estimates U.S. physical retail video game sales rose 21% Y/Y, reversing July's 19% decline as new titles stoked demand ahead of this fall's console refreshes. Games launched in August accounted for over half of all sales, and their high price tags resulted in ASPs rising 25%.
    • GameStop (GME +5%) investors are pleased with the numbers. So are Electronic Arts (EA +2.7%), and Take-Two (TTWO +3%) investors; while still important, NPD's figures matter a little less than they used to for game developers, thanks to a shift towards digital revenue streams.
    • Not surprisingly, hardware sales fell 40% Y/Y (worse than July's 34% drop), as gamers wait for the chance to buy a PS4 or Xbox One. Sales of accessories, including Skylanders (ATVI +0.6%) toys, rose 7% after falling 3% in July. Nintendo's (OTCPK:NTDOY) 3DS was the best-selling console; 6.47M units of the handheld console have been sold in the U.S. in 2013.
    • Though its first-week sales disappointed, EA's Madden NFL 25 was the month's best-selling title. Take-Two's anticipated Grand Theft Auto V launches on Tuesday.
    • Analysts expect GTA V to pull in $1B+ in sales in Take-Two's FY14 (ends March '14). Pac Crest downgraded Take-Two earlier this week, arguing (among other things) the company has an "empty pipeline" and that there's "potential for changes" in Take-Two's relationship with GTA franchise developer Rockstar Games.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • TEVA

    Teva catches a downgrade from JPMorgan

    • JPMorgan downgrades Teva (TEVA -1.4%) to Neutral from Overweight.
    • A dramatic, near-term recovery for the drugmaker isn't likely, analyst Chris Schott suggests, and while the company could see "greater-than-anticipated EPS upside from cost-restructuring initiatives, near-term upside in either earnings or multiple," isn't likely.
    • Price target cut to $43 from $45.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • LAKE

    SA Pro pick Lakeland Industries soars 38% after earnings

    • U.S. operating income of $479K in Q2 compares to a loss of $787K a year ago.Â Worldwide sales grew 4.9% Y/Y, excluding Brazil, up 22%.
    • The company believes it has completely recovered from the loss of the DuPont license in July 2011 as far as gross margins and profitability.
    • CEO Ryan: "As I have said in previous public disclosures, our focus and time is being devoted to downsizing the expenses in Brazil to conform same to its existing sales and we hope to be there by our fiscal year end in January 2014."
    • Kudos to SA Pro's Whopper Investments who highlighted the value in LAKE on May 30 with the shares trading in the $3.50 range. After today's gain, they're 63% higher. Alas, Whopper missed out on today's move, having unloaded his stakeÂ (at a nice profit) after the company's refinancing deal in July.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • URALL

    Report: Kerimov selling Uralkali stake for $3.7B

    • Rumors that Russian billionaire Suleiman Kerimov is selling his 21.7% stake in potash producer Uralkali (OTC:URALL) reach a fever pitch, as news agency RIA Novosti reports a $3.7B sale to investor Vladimir Kogan; so far, neither party has issued a comment.
    • POT +3.9%, MOS +3.8%, AGU +1.7%, IPI +6.1%, SQM +2%.
    • ETFs: MOO, CROP, PAGG, VEGI.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics falls as Ostrer speaks, new court case unfolds

    • Shares of Myriad Genetics (MYGN -4.1%)Â come under pressure.
    • The company was back in federal court this week seeking an injunction against two companies (Ambry Genetics and Gene by Gene) who jumped on the opportunity to offer competing diagnostic tests in the wake of a Supreme Court decision earlier this year which limited MYGN's gene patents. (previous coverage)
    • In the current case, MYGN claims the two companies' programs depend upon so-called "primers" which are still patent-protected.
    • Meanwhile, JPMorgan is apparently hosting a call with Dr. Harry Ostrer (a key figure in the original case). According to market chatter, Dr. Ostrer thinks MYGN may have "under-reported" risk, says he doubts if MYGN BRCA is a "gold standard", and is even questioning if the company is viable as a standalone business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • STP

    Suntech CEO/acting CFO resigning, director assuming reigns for now

    • Suntech (STP +5.9%) CEO and acting CFO David King is resigning. Executive Director Zhou Weiping has been named interim CEO and CFO. Suntech says it will "first commence a search for a new CFO." (PR)
    • King was named CEO in Aug. 2012, replacing founder Shi Zhengrong in the wake of a startling Italian accounting fraud disclosure. King held the CEO position Suntech's as Chinese unit filed for bankruptcy, and the company launched a massive restructuring.
    • Shares have rallied on news of the C-suite shakeup.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale gains after McCormack discloses raised stake

    • Aeropostale (ARO +3%) pops after Patrick McCormack's Tiger Consumer Management discloses an 8.2% stake in company, nearly double what the fund held as of the end of Q2.
    • SEC form 13G.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • SLS

    Galena prices offering, shares plunge

    • Galena Biopharma (GALE -16.4%) craters after announcing a public offering of common stock and warrants Thursday evening.
    • The company priced the offering at $2/unit Friday.
    • The units comprise one share of common and a warrant to buy 0.35 of a share at $2.50/share.
    • There's also an underwriter option for another 2.6M shares of common and/or warrants for ~919K shares. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon continues to run on Q2 results, growth outlook, Sterne Agee PT hike

    • Ulta Salon (ULTA +15.6%) shares continue to run following the company's Q2 beat.
    • Comparable store sales increased 8.4% in Q2, following a 9.7% increase in Q2 2012. Ulta opened 25 new stores in Q2, and total square footage increased 25% Y/Y. (PR)
    • Management guided for Q3 revenue of $613M-$623M (consensus of $618.5M), EPS of $0.71-$0.74 (consensus of $0.76), and comparable store sales growth of 8.4%. The company reiterated full-year guidance.
    • Sterne Agee raisesÂ its PT to $125 ($104 previous), citing increased confidence in its outlook of the company's growth and itsÂ new CEO.
    • CEO Mary Dillon on the conference call: "I expect that share gains will come through new store growth, healthy same-store sales growth, driven by new customer acquisition and more frequent visits of existing customers who are attracted by newness in our offering and the strength of our marketing and loyalty programs."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM

  • Southeast Asia cautious ahead of Fed, Philippine shares fall

    • Southeast Asian shares closed the week on a quiet note Friday, ahead of what many believe will be a pivotal week for emerging markets.
    • Most markets ended largely flat, although Philippine shares (EPHE) slipped 1% and the JCI (IDX, EIDO, IDXJ) managed a 0.4% gain on the heels of Bank Indonesia's latest rate hike.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • INTC

    A roundup of tech ratings changes

    • Intel (INTC +2.5%) has been upgraded to Buy by Jefferies in the wake of the Intel Developer Forum and its many product announcements (I, II).
    • Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -0.9%) has been cut to Market Perform by BMO following a huge summer rally.
    • Former JV partners Verizon (VZ +0.8%) and Vodafone (VOD +0.9%) have been upgraded to Overweight by Evercore. Vodafone just won a closely-watched shareholder vote for the Kabel Deutschland deal.
    • Oclaro (OCLR +15.1%) has been upgraded to Buy by B. Riley in response to the II-VI deal.
    • Akamai (AKAM +1.3%) has been upgraded to Buy by Canaccord.
    • Monolithic Power (MPWR -2.2%) has been cut to Hold by Needham.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • RMTI

    Rockwell Medical rises on Craig-Hallum note, SFP in focus

    • Rockwell Medical (RMTI +12.4%) trades higher in early action.
    • Craig-Hallum has initiated the shares at Buy with a $16 price target (slightly less optimistic than the $25 objective Summer Street slapped on the shares post-CRUISE-2).
    • The firm thinks SFP is set to become the standard of care.
    • Apparently mentioned in the note is RMTI's potential to reduce erythropoiesis stimulating agent usage. This may end up threatening Amgen's (NASDAQ:AMGN) Epogen and Aranesp, although, as SA contributor Paulo Santos notes, the potential hit to Aranesp might be a larger concern because Epogen is "losing patent protection now, so it's going to be pressured anyway."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • GLA

    Imation jumps on Lake Street Capital initiation

    • Shares of Imation (IMN +3.6%) spike at the open after Lake Street Capital initiates the storage/data security company at Buy with a PT of $8 (potential upside of 91.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar engages financial advisor for offshore debt

    • LDKÂ Solar (NYSE:LDK) +2.6% premarket after saying it is engaging Jefferies as financial advisor for strategic advice in connection with its offshore debt obligations.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • SSYS

    Stratasys -5.4% premarket after upsizing offering, pricing it at $93

    • Stratasys (NASDAQ:SSYS) is now offering 4.5M shares, up from a prior 4M. Underwriters have a 675K-share overallotment option (600K prior). (PR)
    • Net proceeds (assuming the overallotment option isn't exercised) are expected to total $402.2M. In the prospectus, Stratasys says possible uses of the proceeds include " financing possible acquisitions, working capital and capital expenditures."
    • Shares are now trading slightly below the offering price. They're down 19% from their Aug. 26 high, but still up 16% YTD.
    • Yesterday: 3D printing stocks slump
     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile makes new highs again after launching music app

    • NQ Mobile (NQ) +4.6% premarket after announcing the launch of Music Radar, an app that (like SoundHound or Shazam) can identify a song being picked up through a device's microphone (even if sung or hummed).(PR)
    • Baidu recently added a similar feature to its music app. NQ asserts its product is differentiated by means of "an innovative melody recognition engine."
    • Shares now +252% YTD, aided by good earnings news and a broader rally for Chinese Internet stocks. Nonetheless, short interest has been steadily growing, and amounted to 25.6% of the float as of Aug. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • PRAN

    Prana delays release of Huntington's data, shares sink

    • Prana Biotechnology (NASDAQ:PRAN) — which has risen some 115% since the end of June — sinks 9.7% premarket.
    • In reference to a Phase 2 Huntington's trial completed in July, the company says "there has been a delay in finalizing the database to achieve 'database lock', required before statistical analysis of the data can begin."
    • Results will now be delayed until "early 2014."
    • "Apart from the timing delay, which is disappointing, nothing has changed," CEO Geoffrey Kempler says. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • VIRC

    Virco beats by $0.04, misses on revenues

    • Virco (NASDAQ:VIRC): Q2 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $56.9M (-5.7% Y/Y) misses by $3.1M.
    • Shares +3.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
  • AET

    Aetna moves higher on BofA upgrade

    • Aetna (NYSE:AET) ticks 1.2% higher before the bell.
    • BofA upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • PACT

    Pactera buyout offer cut to $7

    • Pactera Technology (NASDAQ:PACT) slips 4.1% to $6.50 in premarket action after Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and company management reduce their go-private offer to $7 per share from $7.50. Pactera says it is evaluating the new proposal.
    • SEC Form 13 (page 13 for the money shot).
    • Previous: The $7.50 bid from May.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • OVAS-OLD

    OvaScience files to sell shares

    • OvaScience (NASDAQ:OVAS-OLD) — which has fallen 28% since FDA scrutiny of Augment thrust the company into the center of the HCT/P debate — files to sell some 11.6M shares for holders.
    • Around 3.9M of the shares were issued in connection to a March offering, while the remaining 7.6M shares were part of various private placements.
    • OVAS -1.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • SWY

    Safeway up 3% pre-market on 2-notch Credit Suisse upgrade

    • Shares of Safeway (NYSE:SWY) are up 3% pre-market after Credit Suisse upgrades the grocer 2 notches to Outperform and raises its PT to $34 from $26.
    • The rating change reflects low valuation and the belief that new CEO Robert Edwards is considering options to unlock shareholder value. These include divestment of weaker-performing assets like stores in Southern California, which could yield 20% upside.
    Â 
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech rises on Needham upgrade

    • Oncolytics Biotech (NASDAQ:ONCY) jumps 5% premarket.
    • Likely behind the move is an upgrade to Buy at Needham.
    • Price target is $8, good for a 190% upside from Thursday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • WFT

    Weatherford upgraded at Credit Suisse, shares +2%

    • Weatherford International (NYSE:WFT) +2% premarket after Credit Suisse upgrades shares to Outperform from Neutral with a $19 price target, up from $13.
    • WFT fell nearly 5% yesterday after its CFO departed unexpectedly, but the firm thinks the selloff ignores incrementally improving fundamentals from asset sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM

  • Gold set to break under $1,300

    • The action is again in precious metals where gold looks like it may break underneath $1,300 again. The metal's off 1.5% to $1,311 per ounce. Silver's down 2.1% to $21.68.
    • Today's excuse for selling looks to be he rumored imminent nomination of Larry Summers to be Fed chief. Summers brings with him what is assumed to be a more hawkish attitude than his competitor for the job, Janet Yellen, and he's made clear his ambivalence about the efficacy of the QE program.
    • GLD -0.8%, SLV -0.8% premarket.
    • ETFs:Â GLD, IAU, SGOL, PHYS, AGOL, DGL, UBG, DGP, UGL, DZZ, GLL, DGZ, UGLD, DGLD, GLDI,Â SLV, SIVR, AGQ, DBS, USV, ZSL, USLV, DSLV, SLVO.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM

  • EU stocks on the slide

    • European shares are solidly lower heading into the weekend, with the mood possibly dampened by a Nikkei report that QE skeptic Larry Summers is set to be named as Chairman of the Fed, although it's worth noting that U.S. stock futures are only flat to slightly lower.
    • Given that the report is coming from Japan, doubts about its veracity exist. "You have to wonder just how credible it is. I mean it would be understandable if the New York Times or the Wall Street Journal were reporting this," says one trader.
    • Investors may also be positioning themselves for a FOMC meeting next week, when the Fed could start tapering.
    • EU Stoxx 50 -0.3%, London -0.3%, Paris -0.1%, Frankfurt -0.3%, Milan -0.2%, Madrid -0.5%.
    • Dow futures -0.05%. S&P -0.15%. Nasdaq flat.
    • EU ETFs - EZU, VGK, FEZ, EPV, IEV, ADRU, FEP, FDD, UPV, EPV, DFE, FEU, FEEU.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 AM

  • Asia ending week on a low

    • Asian shares mostly fall ahead of the FOMC's policy meeting next week - when it could decide to taper - with Wall Street's losses overnight and a lack of trading cues weighing on sentiment.
    • Tokyo enjoys a tiny bit of strength prior to a three-day weekend, helped by a softer yen.
    • Japan +0.1%, Hong Kong -0.2%, China -0.9%, India -0.1%.
    • ETFs: ADRA, AIA, VPL, ASDR, AAXJ, AXJS, EPP, GMF, GMFS, AXJL, UXJ, JPX, PAF, ASEA, EEMA, DVYA
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 AM

  • U.S. stock futures flat-to-lower following Summers report

    • U.S. stock futures took a bit of a dive earlier - possibly on a knee-jerk reaction to a report that Larry Summers is set to be named the next Fed chief - before recovering a bit.
    • Dow -0.1%. S&P -0.15%. Nasdaq flat.
    • In contrast, the U.S. dollar index spikes before giving back some gains, and is now +0.2%.
    • 10-year Treasury yieds +3.5 bps to 2.94%.
    • Gold is -1.1% and crude oil is -0.1%.
    • ETFs: IVV, SPY, VOO, RWL, SFLA, SSO, UPRO, SDS, SPXU, SH, EPS, RSP, BXUB, BXUC, BXDB, DIA, DDM, UDOW, DXD, SDOW, DOG, QQQ, QQEW, TQQQ, QID, SQQQ, PSQ, QLD, QQQE OIL, USO, DBO, OLO, USL, CRUD, UCO, DTO, SCO, SZO, DNO, UWTI, DWTI
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 AM
